jamesmisc 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Asses normality using a QQ plot, a histogram with normal density curve superimposed, and a Shapiro-Wilk test for normality

check_normality.Rd

This function takes a data frame and a string of the variable name for which you wish to assess normality, and outputs the QQ plot, the histogram with superimposed normal curve, and the results of the Shapiro-Wilk test.

Usage

check_normality(data, variable_name, just_qqplot = F, just_shapiro_pval = F)

Arguments

data

A data frame with the variable of interest.

variable_name

A character; the name of the variable of interest. The variable's sample size must be between 3 and 5,000, inclusive.

just_qqplot

A logical; do you want just the qqplot? TRUE/FALSE. Default is FALSE.

just_shapiro_pval

A logical; do you want just the Shapiro-Wilk p-value? TRUE/FALSE. Default is FALSE.

Value

A qqplot, a histogram of the variable's distribution with a normal curve superimposed, and the results of a Shapiro-Wilk test.

Examples

# Assess the normality of mpg in mtcars
check_normality(ChickWeight,"weight")


#> 
#> 	Shapiro-Wilk normality test
#> 
#> data:  myvar
#> W = 0.90866, p-value < 2.2e-16
#>
